conclusion: Analyze the system step by step to predict which container the liquid will flow into.
The liquid flows out from points labeled A, B, and C.
The orange liquid from A will flow downwards and curve slightly before entering Container D.
The pink liquid from B will flow down and to the right, curving to enter Container E.
The teal liquid from C will flow down and to the left, curving downward before entering Container D.
Container D is on the left side of the image.
Container E is on the right side of the image.
Orange liquid from A enters Container D.
Pink liquid from B enters Container E.
Teal liquid from C enters Container D.
The orange liquid from A and the teal liquid from C will flow into Container D. The pink liquid from B will flow into Container E.
